titlestmt.titleproper: Annals of the Wagner Free Institute of Science 1855-1884
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

did.unittitle: Annals of the Wagner Free Institute of Science

bioghist.p: Incorporated by William Wagner in 1855, the Wagner Free Institute is a natural history museum and educational institution in Philadelphia that is dedicated to providing free public education in the sciences. William Wagner originally offered free lectures and classes in his home and at Spring Garden Hall. He later constructed an Institute building, which opened to the public in 1865.

scopecontent.p: This volume is William Wagner's record of the founding and running of the Wagner Free Institute of Science between 1855 and 1884. It includes a brief history of the Wagner Free Institute of Science, and minutes of the meeting at which the Institute was incorporated. The volume serves as a day book for the Institute, with detailed entries of lectures delivered, records of attendance, lists of faculty, gifts and purchases, and notes on the building and its maintenance. The collection also includes letters from William Wagner to various members of the Board of Trustees, which have been removed from the volume and are housed in a separate folder.

accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Wagner Free Institute of Science: William Wagner lectures (89-015) includes a series of Wagner's lectures. These may correspond to lectures noted in the Annals.
